name: REQUEST - meele build in high magic world
author: cromac

posts.author: cromac
posts.content:
Hello,

I would like to ask for a advise about a build with good ration between AB/AC.
I was thinking about cleric/wm/?? but I am open for your suggestions.

PvM or PvP? - PvM
Level cap? - 40
Race preference? - no preference
Melee preference? - 1h weapon, shield and plate armor
Weapon preference? - scimitar
Maximum item enhancement? - +7 armors, weapons +8 but +5 is easily available, perma haste items available
Spellcasting? - No offesive spellcasting, buffing only
Custom factors? - cannot use Bard after PM level
Feats? Devastating critical

You help will be highly appreciate.

Thank you

Cromac

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Well, Cromac, if you are going for offense AND defense, I could suggest my Cursed Half-Dragon Chanter build. It's a Bard / PM / RDD built in a very offensive way (but with a defensive class combo). Starts very weak, but grows to be quite a force to be reckoned with in melee combat. The only slight problem is that it only has 3 attacks per round, but in such high magic environments it would miss most of the time anyway on that last attack if it had one, so it matters little. You can tweak it to use the weapon of your choice, and also for Devcrit, but that would make it much less functional IMO, not worth the trade. If you still want it, you can drop Blind Fight, Knockdown and Extend Spell for Power Attack, Cleave and Great Cleave, and two Great Strengths for Overcrit and Devcrit.

Here is the link:

The Cursed Half-Dragon Chanter

Other alternatives:

Mith's Hierophant of Valsharoon you would have to tweak this one to take all Bard levels before PM (lose a coupe of AC points and UMD also, which is bad in high magic).

My Holy Weapon Master With Cheese You can balance at will. basically, the more STR you put, the more AB you get, the more CHA you put, the more AC you get (via Divine Shield). It doesn't have Devastating Critical, but it has DEVASTATING CRITICALS if you know what I mean.

My HOOD This build doesn't necessarily rely on AC to defend. It has 15 points of DR, which coupled with a belt of damage resistance is AWESOME, and also has Terrifying Rage to scare the crap out of the weak-willed. It does get Devastating Critical.

Mith's Blood & Faith This is one of the all-time greats of this guild. A true POWERHOUSE. No Devcrit, though, but can be tweaked into the build.

I could also refer you to Grizz's Charnel Lord, but the truth is that with that PM / Bard restriction, it just wouldn't work.

However, if you're looking for balance between AB and AC, I'm thinking DEX build. Cuz then the AB stat is the AC stat. I have a VERY HIGH AB AND AC BUILD WITH EPIC DODGE, which is just south of a Fighter / Bard / RDD or Fighter / Weapon Master / Rogue build in terms of AB but more than makes up for it in terms of AC and has ED, which is excellent. Take a look and see what you think:

Drow Fencer

You have to understand that there is no way a build can have it all. The Drow Fencer doesn't have a lot of damage output, but it does have great AB, great AC and Epic Dodge, plus Sneak Attacks to deal damage against the non-immune. You can't have AB, AC AND Damage AND Devcrit AND etc... to get something you need to give up something else, it's always like this.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
With your Cleric RDD build, I'd shuffle the pre-epic feats. Starting at level 9, I'd take Blind Fight, Extend Spell, Improved Critical, and then Great Cleave.

In the Fighter Bard RDD build, you could lower DEX to 8 and put those points in CHA to be able to cast spells, but you would lose 2 AC and lower your Reflex saves by 2, already your weakest save. Or, you couild lower your starting STR by 2, lowering your AB, damage, and Dev Crit DC by 1. I don't think it would be worth it because your Bard spells would be few, weak, and super easy to dispel. Also, you would have to take off your armor to be able to cast.

Cromac
In that case, yes, it does, but 8 x per day for 10 rounds, my bad, I misinterpreted.

I think what I'm trying to argue is that it's not cost-effective to do that. That song will cost you 3 epic feats (if you go Fighter, you get 3 epic bonus feats at 24,. 26 and 28) plus an extra feat that you'll use to take for Curse Song. So yeah, you will receive +2 situational and limited duration AC (which you'll probably need to recast every battle in the middle of combat) and minor dispellable low duration buffs in exchange for 3 epic feats and 1 pre-epic feat. IMO not worth the trade.

Take it EZ!
